name: Negative Crunches
how_to_perform:
1. Lie on your back with the soles of the feet resting flat on the ground.
2.Grab a resistance band or have someone hold one end for you, if no equipment is available.
3.Lift yourself up off the ground using only your abs to support yourself, focusing on keeping your body straight from head to heels.
4.As you lift yourself up, pull down gently on the resistance band (if using) with both hands to help engage your core muscles more effectively.
5.Slowly lower yourself back down to the starting position in a controlled motion, avoiding any jerky movements or bouncy effects.
6.Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
short_summary: Negative crunches are an abdominal exercise that targets the rectus abdominis muscle and other core muscles, performed by lifting the body up from a prone position and lowering back down while engaging the core muscles throughout the movement.
